43 // Weird wee function that can help clean the linear velocity component
44 // of the odometry information. There's a little noise which could cause
45 // issues and it's more straightforward for now just to remove it.
46 // This is by no means required. Didn't use it for the yaw because I
47 // don't think there's any advantage to cleaning that up.
48 inline double clean_velocity(double lin_vel, int factor=100){
49  if (factor == 0) return 0;
50  return ((double) ((int) (lin_vel * factor))) / factor;
51 }

79 int main(int argc, char **argv){
80  ros::init(argc, argv, "test_cx_subscriber");
81  ros::NodeHandle n;
82 
83  // ROS networking
84 
85  // Get cue - Sub to visual cues
86  ros::Subscriber sub = n.subscribe("cue_list", 1000, cue_list_callback);
87 
88  // Request velocity changes from velocity service
89  client = n.serviceClient<bb_util::velocity>("update_velocity");
90 
91  // Set up VM Server
92  // vm_server = n.advertiseService("vm_management", manage_vm);
93 
94  // Set up publisher for CX
95  pub = n.advertise<bb_util::vmcx_activity>("vmcx_status", 1);
96 
97  ROS_INFO("Running...");
98 
99  ros::spin();
100 
101  return 0;
